channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Kane winner sends England into Euro 2020 final
item.description: Battling England come from behind to beat Denmark after extra time on a truly memorable night at Wembley and reach a first major men's tournament final for the first time since 1966.

item.title: Surfside tower collapse: 'Zero' hope of finding survivors
item.description: Crews have switched to a recovery operation following the deadly collapse of an apartment block.

item.title: Covid: Millions could be self-isolating between now and 16 August
item.description: BBC analysis shows more than 4.5 million people could be asked to self-isolate before 16 August.

item.title: Jacob Zuma: South Africa's former president hands himself over to police
item.description: The ex-president was given a 15-month jail term after he failed to attend a corruption inquiry.

item.title: Covid: Cases in UK rise above 30,000 for first time since January
item.description: More than 32,500 confirmed cases have been reported in the country, up 43% on the same day last week.

item.title: Federer 'really does not know' if he will play Wimbledon again
item.description: Roger Federer says he "really does not know" if he will play at Wimbledon again after losing to Poland's Hubert Hurkacz in the quarter-finals.

item.title: World's tallest sandcastle built in Denmark
item.description: Standing at higher than 21m in the Danish town of Blokhus, it is even decorated with Covid particles.

item.title: Gates Foundation agrees break-up back-up plan
item.description: The deal would give Melinda Gates the option to resign and receive "personal resources" for further charity work.

item.title: Haiti President Jovenel Moïse killed in attack at home
item.description: Jovenel Moïse is shot dead and the first lady injured by gunmen in the capital, Port-au-Prince.

item.title: Peter R de Vries: Shooting of investigative reporter stuns Dutch
item.description: Peter R de Vries's family and politicians condemn the attack, as he fights for his life in hospital.

item.title: Lithuania plans barrier on Belarus border to stem migrant flow
item.description: More than 1,000 migrants have been held after crossing the border since 1 June, officials say.

item.title: Security minister resigns to focus on cancer recovery
item.description: James Brokenshire stands down as security minister as lung cancer treatment takes "longer than expected".

item.title: Backlash against longer hours to ease lorry driver shortage
item.description: Grant Shapps says the move will ease a driver shortage, but the industry calls it a sticking plaster.

item.title: Six the Musical actress 'gobsmacked' at on-stage proposal
item.description: Natalie Pilkington's boyfriend popped the question at the end of a performance of the musical Six.

item.title: Kane keeps his cool to score England winner
item.description: Captain Harry Kane steps and sees his penalty saved by Kasper Schmeichel but manages to convert the follow-up to put England ahead 2-1 against Denmark in their semi-final tie at Wembley.

item.title: Euro 2020: England fans celebrate as Three Lions make final
item.description: England fans celebrate beating Denmark 2-1 in extra time at Euro 2020 to set up a final against Italy.

item.title: England reach Euro 2020 final: Gareth Southgate 'so pleased for our country'
item.description: England manager Gareth Southgate says he is "so pleased for our country" after booking their place in the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Euro 2020: Fans euphoric as England beat Denmark to reach final
item.description: Fans cheered on England as they beat Denmark 2-1 in the Euro 2020 semi-final.

item.title: England into Euros final: Declan Rice learns of new niece moments after win
item.description: Imagine having a baby at the same moment Harry Kane scores the winning goal to reach the Euro 2020 final?

item.title: Fifty-five years, 302 games and more than 140,000 miles - England's pursuit of final number two
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look at the statistics behind England's 55-year wait to reach a major tournament final.

item.title: Euro 2020 England 2-1 Denmark: Mikkel Damsgaard's 'delightful' free-kick gives Denmark lead
item.description: Mikkel Damsgaard beats goalkeeper Jordan Pickford with a sensational free-kick to put Denmark 1-0 up against England in their semi-final tie at Wembley.

item.title: Euros 2020: What all of us can learn from Gareth Southgate
item.description: The England boss has turned to experts outside football to help prepare his team. Should we all take note?

item.title: England v Denmark: How Luke Shaw went from Jose Mourinho's fall-guy to Euro 2020 star
item.description: Humiliated by Jose Mourinho, Luke Shaw has recovered to become England's most creative attacking force at Euro 2020. So how has he done it?

item.title: England v Denmark: Atomic Kitten star on viral song Southgate You're The One
item.description: Natasha Hamilton belts out the updated version of hit song Whole Again for the BBC's Ben Brown.

item.title: Euro 2020: Denmark’s journey through the eyes of the country
item.description: Denmark are riding the crest of a wave at the European Championship, but how have those from the country seen the tournament and how far the team will go?

item.title: Euros: What's it like to have Gareth Southgate as your manager?
item.description: From shooting hoops to giving one-on-one pep talks, we hear about the England manager's style.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Finally!' say papers after England's thrilling win
item.description: England's thrilling win over Denmark, taking them to the Euro final, leads most of the front pages.

item.title: Buckingham Palace gardens will open to public
item.description: The garden at Buckingham Palace will open to the public from Friday 9 July until Sunday 19 September.

item.title: Eleventh night bonfires getting ready in NI
item.description: Hundreds of bonfires are being built in Northern Ireland as part of traditional commemorations.

item.title: South China Sea: The battle for Scarborough Shoal
item.description: The BBC's Howard Johnson gained rare access to the disputed coral reef in the South China Sea.

item.title: Man sits on toilet, gets bitten by python in Austria
item.description: Walter Erhart, 65, got a shock when his neighbour's snake escaped and got into his sewage pipe.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival rolls out red carpet again after year off
item.description: Stars and photographers cram the red carpet for the first major film festival since the pandemic.

item.title: Wembley park stabbings: Nicole and Bibaa's mother 'has no peace' after murder conviction
item.description: Mina Smallman says the man who murdered her daughters, Nicole and Bibaa, has "no power in our lives".

item.title: Big stars to play small shows as live music returns
item.description: Sir Tom Jones, Rag 'n' Bone Man and Sam Fender will all play grassroots venues over the summer.

item.title: The police defecting as a new civil war looms in Myanmar
item.description: As Myanmar heads towards a new civil war, the BBC hears from police officers who defected after the coup.

item.title: 'Probation officers are the forgotten part of the criminal justice system'
item.description: Probation officer Sam Gildersleeve shows us a job that often isn't seen in police shows.

item.title: The Spice Girls at 25: Here's the story from A to Z
item.description: Easy V doesn't come for free, but this guide to the Spice Girls' career will cost you nothing.

item.title: Australia mice plague: How farmers are fighting back
item.description: There's a debate in Australia about how to deal with a huge plague of mice in the east of the country.

item.title: How de-cluttering grew Facebook Marketplace to 1bn users
item.description: As Covid shut charity shops thrifty second-hand traders shifted online to bag a bargain, in droves.

item.title: The growing Gulf rivalry that's pushing up oil prices
item.description: A public rift between Saudi Arabia and the UAE caused talks between oil exporters to be abandoned.

item.title: Ethiopia's River Nile dam: How it will be filled
item.description: It is not like a bath with a tap that can be turned on and off at will.

item.title: Peter R de Vries: The Dutch crime reporter who defied death threats
item.description: Hailed as a national hero, Peter R de Vries spent decades investigating the criminal underworld.

item.title: Why North America's killer heat scares me
item.description: It's not the new record temperatures that concern the BBC's Roger Harrabin - it's the way they were smashed.

item.title: Dying too young: Maps show little has changed in 170 years
item.description: Why do areas with high Covid death rates match places with the worst health in Victorian times?

item.title: Ray BLK: Why debut album Access Denied has taken so long to make
item.description: The RnB singer felt lost after winning a huge award that she'd hoped would fast-track her to success.

item.title: Right to repair movement gains power in US and Europe
item.description: Lawmakers and advocates want to give consumers more choice when it comes to fixing devices.

item.title: Afghanistan withdrawal stokes fears of al-Qaeda comeback
item.description: An emboldened Taliban has raised the spectre of international terrorism making an unwelcome return.

item.title: The push to get Australian men and boys to open up
item.description: Australia is examining beliefs about what makes "real men" in a bid to reduce suicide and violence.

item.title: Russia hacking claims pose challenge for Biden
item.description: After a string of Russian-linked hacks, how will US President Joe Biden respond?

item.title: How Paula Rego remains a master storyteller
item.description: The artist's new exhibition asserts her status as one of Britain's leading figurative painters.

item.title: Euro 2020 England v Denmark: Harry Kane scores winner as England reach Euro 2020 final
item.description: Watch highlights as captain Harry Kane's follow up from a penalty miss sends England through to their first major men's final since 1966, beating Denmark 2-1 after extra time at Wembley.

item.title: Euro 2020 England 2-1 Denmark: Ecstatic Gareth Southgate leads England celebrations at raucous Wembley
item.description: Watch as Gareth Southgate and the England team national team celebrate with a raucous Wembley crowd, sharing a rendition of 'Sweet Caroline' after beating Denmark 2-1 to advance to the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: 'This is not a team, it's a family' - pundits react to England win
item.description: BBC pundits react as England beat Denmark in extra time to reach their first major final in 55 years.

item.title: Much-changed Lions overcome Covid uncertainty to thrash Sharks
item.description: The British and Irish Lions overcome rising coronavirus uncertainty to claim a composed eight-try win against the Sharks.

item.title: Barty set for 'incredible opportunity' in Wimbledon semi-finals
item.description: Top seed Ashleigh Barty plays former champion Angelique Kerber and Aryna Sabalenka meets Karolina Pliskova in Thursday's Wimbledon semi-finals.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Djokovic roars, celeb spotting & banana mind games - day nine best bits
item.description: Watch the best bits from day nine of Wimbledon including the men's quarter-finals, a host of famous faces on centre court and some "banana mind games".

item.title: Will hairdressers need to wear masks after 19 July? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about England's roadmap out of lockdown, and other Covid-related issues.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: What are the rules for pubs, restaurants, festivals and gigs?
item.description: Near-normal service should resume in pubs and restaurants in England from 19 July.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and receptions, and when will they ease?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings are continuing to ease across the UK, so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: The prime minister has announced the next steps for easing social distancing in England.
